meanings.definition: To perform ostentatiously in an attempt to impress onlookers.
meanings.sent1: During the talent show, Sarah grandstanded by singing loudly and dancing dramatically.
meanings.sent2: The politician grandstanded by making big promises to the crowd.
meanings.sent3: At the party, Tom grandstanded by telling exaggerated stories about his adventures.
meanings.sent4: She grandstanded her way through the presentation, trying to steal the spotlight.
meanings.sent5: The actor grandstanded on stage, hoping to capture the audience's attention.

meanings.definition: To behave in a showy or self-important manner.
meanings.sent1: The peacock grandstanded by flaunting its colorful feathers to attract a mate.
meanings.sent2: He always grandstanded at work, showing off his achievements to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The cat grandstanded by walking around like it owned the place.
meanings.sent4: The CEO grandstanded during the meeting, trying to assert dominance.
meanings.sent5: The child grandstanded by pretending to be a superhero, saving imaginary cities.
